instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01041A: What is 820-01041A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS: What is PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS? PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS is 20v in from the USB-C charger on USB-C powered Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP1V8_S5: What is PP1V8_S5? PP1V8_S5 is a 1.8v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
threads.message:
Hello ,

I have <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2018 macbook pro  . The MB number is: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
A little bit of water touched the USB C port of <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> ( i think that only in one of them ).
No trace of liquid damage .

Here is the situation:

At the beginning all the 4 USB C ports were stuck on 5V and draw 380mA - 400mA .
After power rail check and ACE LDO check i decided to replace <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> .

The new situation is this :

USB C ports of UB300 and UB400 are stuck on 20v and drawing after a current cycle 110mA . I already checked SSD0 power rail and i am getting 2.5v.
i can also say that i have all the power rails including the <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> which is 3.38v ( the power sequence was taken from  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>). moreover in this case <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 1.329v and <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S5</SIGNAL> is 0.44v however no short on those rails . <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> resistance to ground is 74Kohm and <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S5</SIGNAL> is 23.33Kohm.
forgot to mention that all the ACE LDO voltage are present.

USB C ports of <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> are stuck on 5v and drawing 380mA - 400mA .
For those chips the 2 X 1.<SIGNAL>8V_LDO</SIGNAL> and the 3.<SIGNAL>3V_LDO</SIGNAL> are present however the 1.<SIGNAL>1V_LDO</SIGNAL> is missing.
PPBUS is present 12.6v and also <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is present 3.34v.
I checked the resistance of <CAPACITOR>C3104</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C3204</CAPACITOR> ( Use for CC1 and CC2 communication )  and both of them are 198kohm.
moreover i checked the CC1(<SIGNAL>USBC_XB</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>XA_CC1</SIGNAL>) and CC2 (<SIGNAL>USB_XB</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>XA_CC2</SIGNAL>)  of those <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> in diode mode and got :
CC1 - 0.585v
CC2 - 0.59v

I also checked the <SIGNAL>ACE_I2C_LINES</SIGNAL> and got the following values on  <RESISTOR>R2834</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R2835</RESISTOR> ( <SIGNAL>I2C_TBT_X_SCL</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>I2C_TBT_X_SDA</SIGNAL> ) [B]Both of them are on 3.31v .[/B]

I also decided to check and compare QB400 and <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> .
Those chips as i see it are responsible to deliver 20v to the board ( <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>).

the results on the [B]working[/B] USB C , QB400 and QB300 :
1. <SIGNAL>UPC_TB_GATE1</SIGNAL> : 26V ( FROM <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>)
2. UNCONNECTED
3. UNCONNECTED
4. <SIGNAL>UPC_TB_GATE2</SIGNAL> : 22.5V ( FROM <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>)
5/6/7 : <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_TB_VBUS</SIGNAL>: 20.37V
8: <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>: 20.37V

the results on the [B]un working[/B] USB C , <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> :
1. <SIGNAL>UPC_XA_GATE1</SIGNAL> : 10.83V ( FROM <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>)
2. <SIGNAL>TP_Q3100_DRAIN</SIGNAL>: 5.11 V
3. UNCONNECTED
4. <SIGNAL>UPC_XA_GATE2</SIGNAL> : 8.27V ( FROM <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>)
5/6/7 : <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL>: 5.11V
8: <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>: 5.11V

the results on the [B]un working[/B] USB C , <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> :
1. <SIGNAL>UPC_XB_GATE1</SIGNAL> : unable to measure ( FROM <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>)
2. <SIGNAL>TP_Q3200_DRAIN</SIGNAL>: 5.11 V
3. UNCONNECTED
4. <SIGNAL>UPC_XB_GATE2</SIGNAL> : 6.87V ( FROM <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>)
5/6/7 : <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS</SIGNAL>: 5.11V
8: <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>: 5.11V


So anyone can please assist ?
why when i replaced <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> the volatge of UB400 and UB300 was increased to 20v but <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> are still stuck on 5v ?
maybe i have a problem in the soldering ? maybe the call to replace <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> was a mistake?
If you read this , please go to the last post. The board fell on the ground and bent a little bit. maybe you have an idea :(

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Always check power rails in diode mode, not ohm scale.
Switch to ohm scale only for very low values; usually under 0.010 reading.
Read here about correct way to do it.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

Disconnect everything from the board; test it alone on the desk.
Of course, keep the charger connected.

Where did you get the new <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip?
Does it have the same termination code?
B03 is not compatible with C00.

 Check <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> traces, solders and adjacent resistors.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
threads.message:
Hey ,

Thank you very much.

I got the new <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> from your store :) , bought 2 chips from you and two other from beetstech. But the soldered on is from your store.
yes , they have the same termination code C00.

I checked <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> :

Pin1 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_CS_L</SIGNAL> : 3.3v
Pin2 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_MISO</SIGNAL> : 3.33v
Pin3 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_ROM_WP_L</SIGNAL> :0.726v
Pin4 GND : 0v
Pin5 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_MOSI</SIGNAL>: 0v
Pin6 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_CLK</SIGNAL>: 0.07v
Pin7 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_ROM_HOLD_L</SIGNAL>: 3.33v
Pin8 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL>: 3.33v

also checked resistors : <RESISTOR>R3095</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R3096</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R3097</RESISTOR> all of them are 15ohm and looks fine.
[B]By the way ,general questions :
1.  Is it normal that one side of USB C port show 20v and the other side show 5V ? And most important why it happened after the replacement of <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>?
2.  How do i know if i replaced the right ACE controller ? maybe i had to replace <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> ? In order to get 1.<SIGNAL>1V_LDO</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> ,do i need to get 1.<SIGNAL>1V_LDO</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> first ?[/B]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
threads.message:
1V1 LDO appears only on the powered port.

Depending which block of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip is affected, you can get 20V on other port.
In such case, may have bad chip on the input side.
It is still able to communicate with SMC (T2), but can't control the input.
That's the reason to get 20V on the other port.
If one <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> doesn't communicate with SMC, will not get 20V on any port.

Now try to replace <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> too.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
threads.message:
Hey ,

When You say :  " If one <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> doesn't communicate with SMC, will not get 20V on any port " , you mean that in the ACE controller pair , even if one of them is faulty , none of them will generate 1.1v LDO and this is why the 20v will not be generate? ( for example  if <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> is faulty and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> is fine so none of them will generate the 1.1v LDO )

And again for my knowledge : at the beginning all the USB C port showed 5v and draw 380mA-390mA . only when i replaced <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> , UB300 and UB400 rise to 20v , but <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> are still stuck on 5v . why did it happened ? why <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> is still stuck on 5v if its okay ?

If replacing <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> will fix the macbook  , the voltage will be 20v and how much current will it draw ?
will replace <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and keep you update

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
threads.message:
You should replace <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and see what happens.
Be sure to get good solders.

The behavior of USB-C ports depends of the internal problem of a <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
threads.message:
Hey ,

Before replacing <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> i looked once again on the trace to <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> . Than i saw that <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> is  a little bit off its pads. Reflow it and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> are now on 20v . Than unfortunately, the board fell on ground and bend a little bit . now all the USB C ports presents 5v and drawing 250mA . :(
Does it means that its over ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
threads.message:
Ooops, that's no good at all.
You may have knocked off components, or even broken solders under BGA chips.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> doesn't turning on
threads.message:
Inspect the board under microscope.
Unfortunatelly, this may be a lost cause...

threads.message:
Hey , 

I checked the board today .
here is what i have till now :

First : all the USB C port are stuck on 5v and drawing 250mA.

1.  All The LDO rails  of each CD3215C are on, of course the LDO 1.1V is on for each  ACE when its connected to power adapter.
2. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> :12.3 v
3. 

 <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> flash - each pin
Pin1 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_CS_L</SIGNAL> : 3.3v
Pin2 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_MISO</SIGNAL> : 3.33v
Pin3 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_ROM_WP_L</SIGNAL> :3.34
Pin4 GND : 0v
Pin5 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_MOSI</SIGNAL>: 1.434v
Pin6 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_SPI_CLK</SIGNAL>: 1.08v
Pin7 <SIGNAL>TBT_X_ROM_HOLD_L</SIGNAL>: 3.33v
Pin8 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL>: 3.33v

4. 
UB090 flash - each pin
Pin1: <SIGNAL>TBT_T_SPI_CS_L</SIGNAL> : 3.34v
Pin2: <SIGNAL>TBT_T_SPI_MISO</SIGNAL>: 3.34v
Pin3: <SIGNAL>TBT_T_ROM_WP_L</SIGNAL> : 3.34v
Pin4 : GND
Pin5 : <SIGNAL>TBT_T_SPI_MOSI</SIGNAL>: 1.51v
Pin6: <SIGNAL>TBT_T_SPI_CLK</SIGNAL>: 1.152v
Pin7: <SIGNAL>TBT_T_ROM_HOLD_L</SIGNAL>: 3.34v
Pin8: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL>: 3.34v
Pin9: GND

5. 
<SIGNAL>I2C_TBT_T_SCL</SIGNAL> (RB034, pin #2)
<SIGNAL>I2C_TBT_T_SDA</SIGNAL> (RB034, pin #2)
[B]the voltage is 0v[/B] 

6.

<SIGNAL>I2C_TBT_X_SCL</SIGNAL> (<RESISTOR>R2834</RESISTOR>, pin # 2)
<SIGNAL>I2C_TBT_X_SDA</SIGNAL> (<RESISTOR>R2835</RESISTOR>, pin # 2)
[B]the voltage is 0v[/B] 
 
7.

 i checked diode mode for the CC1 and CC2 lines:

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> :

CC1 : 0.424
CC2 : 0.472

CC1 : 0.469

Any Idea ?
